alert.note: Alert for Northern Bristol; Southern Bristol (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 8:36PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Bristol, northeastern Kent, eastern Providence and northern Bristol Counties through 930 PM EDT... At 835 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Seekonk, or near East Providence, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Torrential rainfall could lead to minor localized street flooding. Locations impacted include... Providence, Fall River, Warwick, Cranston, Pawtucket, Taunton, East Providence, Cumberland, North Providence, Johnston, North Attleborough, Attleboro, Smithfield, Lincoln, Central Falls, Norton, Somerset, Barrington, Swansea and Seekonk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.
